newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Bakun dam building pact signing postponed again.
newsitem.headline: Bakun dam building pact signing postponed again.

text.p: Ekran Bhd said on Friday that it has again postponed the signing of a construction contract for the $5.5 billion Bakun hydro-electric dam.

Company officials did not provide a reason for the latest postponement or give a new expected signing date. The contract had been scheduled to be signed on September 11, but was rescheduled for September 30.
A consortium led by Asea Brown Boveri AG and Companhia Brasileira Projectos e Obras (CBPO) won the bid for engineering of the dam, located in the East Malaysia state of Sarawak on Borneo island.
A member of the consortium told Reuters they had just been informed about the postponement but that no reason was provided.

The pact for the dam had previously been expected to be signed in August. The controversial project has been bogged down by legal challenges, including the filing of a lawsuit in June that accused Ekran of violating environmental law. The company has denied the charges.
